intro: Alectra gracilis, commonly known as the slender ghostplant, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Lepidobotryaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, thread-like leaves that are often less than 1 centimeter in length. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Alectra gracilis thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in wetlands or along the edges of ponds. Its botanical features make it a unique subject for study in aquatic and semi-aquatic ecosystems.
